content.question: ​Which of the following names a function with a hole in its graph at <math alttext="x equals 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and provides correct reasoning related to the hole?

choices.label: The graph of ​<math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator x squared minus 1 over denominator x minus 1 end fraction"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> has a hole at <math alttext="open parentheses 1 comma 2 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> because the values of <math alttext="fraction numerator x squared minus 1 over denominator x minus 1 end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> get arbitrarily close to <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> for <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-values sufficiently close to <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math>, but the function is undefined at <math alttext="x equals 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>.

The graph of ​<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator x squared plus 1 over denominator x minus 1 end fraction"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> has a hole at <math alttext="x equals 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> because the values of <math alttext="fraction numerator x squared plus 1 over denominator x minus 1 end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> increase without bound for <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-values arbitrarily close to <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math>.

The graph of <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator 4 x minus 4 over denominator x squared plus 1 end fraction"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> has a hole at <math alttext="open parentheses 1 comma 0 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> because the values of <math alttext="fraction numerator 4 x minus 4 over denominator x squared plus 1 end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> are arbitrarily close to <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math> for <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-values sufficiently close to <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math>.

The graph of <math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator 4 x minus 4 over denominator open parentheses x minus 1 close parentheses squared end fraction"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math> has a hole at <math alttext="x equals 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> because the values of <math alttext="4 x minus 4"><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></math> and <math alttext="open parentheses x minus 1 close parentheses squared"><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup></math> are arbitrarily close to <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math> for <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-values sufficiently close to <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math>.

content.answer: The graph of ​<math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator x squared minus 1 over denominator x minus 1 end fraction"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> has a hole at <math alttext="open parentheses 1 comma 2 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> because the values of <math alttext="fraction numerator x squared minus 1 over denominator x minus 1 end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> get arbitrarily close to <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> for <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-values sufficiently close to <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math>, but the function is undefined at <math alttext="x equals 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>.
